TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates construction surfaces and repairs surface geometry. Access commands to create surface bodies.
Revolves a sketch profile or planar face around a selected axis.
Select the profile or planar face then select the axis of revolution.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the profile or planar face then select the axis of revolution.

Description._LCLZText: After selecting the profile and axis, you can select faces or points to set the angular value.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Sweeps a sketch profile or planar face along a selected path.
Select the profile then select the sweep path. The distance for the sweep is a decimal percentage of the selected path.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the profile and the sweep path.

Description._LCLZText: The distance for the sweep is a decimal percentage of the length of the path.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a planar or 3D surface within the boundary of a specified closed loop.
Select the loop to patch then apply connected (G0), tangent (G1), and curvature (G2) boundary conditions.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the loop to patch then apply connected (G0), tangent (G1), and curvature (G2) boundary conditions.

Description._LCLZText: Use Patch to fill an open body with a new surface. Surfaces can be knit together using the Stitch tool.

TextBlock._LCLZText: sycamoreruled tooltip 1
sycamoreruled tooltip 2
Creates a new surface at a given distance from the selected face.
Select the face to offset then specify the distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the face to offset then specify the distance.

Description._LCLZText: Select multiple faces to offset them simultaneously.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a new midsurface shell from the selected body.
Select the face to midsurface.

Tips._LCLZText: Creates a shell part in the middle of the selected body or bodies using the thickness of the selected body.

Description._LCLZText: The use of shells can reduce mesh requirements and solve time. Using this command on a complex body may require slight adjustments with other shellcommands such as Gap Fill.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a new surface shell from the surface.
Select the surface to surface shell.

Tips._LCLZText: Transform surface bodies into shells for Simulation.

Description._LCLZText: A suface body itself will not be considered in simulation until it is transformed into a shell and given a thickness.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Creates a new offset shell at a given distance from the selected face.
Select the face to offset then specify the distance.

Tips._LCLZText: Creates a new shell at a specified distance from selected faces of a 3D body.

Description._LCLZText: Using the Offset Shell command will create a shell to represent the selected body and remove the selected body from the Simulation Model. To recover the original body the Shell must be removed from the timeline, or a new Simulation Model must be created.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Removes the selected area of a surface body using the specified cutting tool.
Select the cutting tool to use then select faces or surface bodies to remove.

Tips._LCLZText: Select a plane or a sketch intersecting a surface as the cutting tool, then select the desired surface to trim.

Description._LCLZText: Surfaces to be trimmed will turn red.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Joins surfaces to make a single surface body or solid body.
Select the surfaces to join. Edges within the tolerance are highlighted green.

Description._LCLZText: Green indicates closed edges, whereas red indicates open edges.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Breaks joined surfaces into individual surfaces.
Select faces to unstitch. The selected face is unhooked from the parent body and the result body contains the unhooked face.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the faces or bodies to unstitch.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Combines the selected faces into a single quilt surface.
Select the faces to merge. You can select solid or surface faces.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the surfaces to merge. You can select solid or surface faces.

TextBlock._LCLZText: Flips the normal direction of the selected surface body.
Checks the quality of selected surfaces and attempts to heal surfaces before stitching into quilts and solids.
Select the surfaces to check, specify a tolerance then select the type of validation to perform.

Tips._LCLZText: Select the surfaces to check, specify a tolerance then select the type of validation to perform.
